Package me.zpath

Interface Function

public interface Function
A Function interface which can be implemented to extend the API with custom functionality
See Also:
  • Configuration.getFunctions()

  • Method Details

    • matches

      boolean matches(String name)
      Return true if the specified function name is implemented by this class
      Parameters:
      name - the name to test
      Returns:
      true if this Funtion supports the name

    • verify

      boolean verify(String name, List<Term> arguments)
      Verify the list of arguments for this function, returning false if they're invalid. As most arguments are resolved at runtime this method will often simply verify the size of the list
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the function
      arguments - the arguments
      Returns:
      true if the function is valid with these arguments

    • eval

      void eval(String name, List<Term> arguments, List<Object> in, List<Object> out, EvalContext context)
      Evaluate the function. There are two possible ways a function can be called 1. It's part of expr in the form path[expr]. If this is the case, "in" will be a list of one item, and context will have context/contextIndex set 2. It's in the form path/function). If this is the case, "in" will be one or more items, and context will be null. In the second case, the function must be careful to not add duplicate nodes to the output.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the function
      arguments - the arguments to the function, which had previously been passed into verify(java.lang.String, java.util.List<me.zpath.Term>)
      in - the Nodes in the input context - there will be at least one node.
      out - the Nodes which can be written to as the output context
      context - the context
